required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Muscle Mass or Muscle Function as a prédictive Tools for Outtcomme in Chronic Dialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study : Muscle Mass or Muscle Function as a prédictive Tools for Outtcomme in Chronic Dialysis Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim of this study is to compare the association of muscle mass and functionality with mortality among chronic haemodialysis
- the involvement of malnutrition inflammation and atherogenesis syndrome (increase in C reactive protein and decrease in serum albumin) on voluntary muscle strength impairment and phyiscal activity.
- the relationship between voluntary muscle strength and mortality
- the relationship between voluntary muscle strength and physical activity

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim of this study is to compare the association of muscle mass and functionality with mortality among chronic haemodialysis
- the involvement of malnutrition inflammation and atherogenesis syndrome (increase in C reactive protein and decrease in serum albumin) on voluntary muscle strength impairment and phyiscal activity.
- the relationship between voluntary muscle strength and mortality
- the relationship between voluntary muscle strength and physical activity

secondary_outcome.description: The Baecke Questionnaire, developed by Voorrips and coworkers, measures habitual physical activity in the elderly. The questionnaire includes questions on household activities, sports, and leisure time activities, over a time period of one year. The Baecke Questionnaire results in a score to classify people as high, moderate, or low in daily physical activity, based on tertiles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- chronic kidney disease patient with extrarenal replacement therapy by hemodialysis for at least 3 months
- stable clinical condition (absence of infection, stroke or acute decompensation)
Exclusion criteria:
- chronic kidney disease without extrarenal replacement therapy
- history of renal transplantation

overall_official.affiliation: CHU Lapeyronie, Department of Biochemistry and Hormonology, Montpellier, FRANCE
